result.execSummary:
The defendant Kendale L Nation was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by November 17, 2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  
*Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge.
Consecutive to: To each other; STRAIGHT TIME; sentence stayed until November 24, 2015 at 5:00 pm.
Consecutive to: To each other; STRAIGHT TIME; sentence stayed until November 24, 2015 at 5:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendale L Nation in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to each other; STRAIGHT TIME; sentence stayed until November 24, 2015 at 5:00 pm.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample.

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by November 17, 2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY:  Court ordered the defendant to pay the DNA surcharge.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kendale L Nation not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendale L Nation in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Daniel Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Counsel is newly appointed on this matter.  Defense is not in receipt of all discovery.  Court ordered the squad video to be turned over to defense by October 7, 2015.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendale L Nation in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Discussions of discovery placed on the record. Court ordered State to provide defense with the 911 call, in squad video, and photos within 14 day's of today's date. Defense requests a Status Conference. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendale L Nation in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kendale L Nation in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Kendale L Nation in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
